column4: sorry about all my ubuntu noob questions... but i downloaded a .jar app where should i place it in my files?
what are you doing with a .jar file , if you are a beginner?
it's minecraft (minecraft.jar) downloaded from minecraft.net
okay djones i guess i can do that for now
djones do you know where all the hidden minecraft files go? such as level saves and stuff
newworld are you still here?

okay i have amd 64 bit processors with the hd radeon integrated graphics. do you know how i get the drivers so i can play games? i got java and minecraft, but the game screen is all black (i'm assuming because no graphics drivers)
nonfree, meaning i have to pay?
where do i get these?
thanks djones i found it about 30 seconds ago lol :p
it's loading hold on
Searching for available drivers
ahh it found AMD drivers for me xD
now should i install normal or (post-release updates) graphics drivers?
what does (post-release updates) mean?
here's the list:
ATI/AMD proprietary FGLRX graphics driver (post-release updates)
ATI/AMD proprietary FGLRX graphics driver
so then i should download post-release?
to get the latest
i believe so. i just downloaded and installed ubuntu yesterday
post-release may be unstable
